column4: you can manually edit /etc/fstab , feisty will have a replacement, and feisty should dynamically update that list even.
oh, I've done that.. I can use the drive.. but I have to go through filesystem, media, sdd3.. the other drives I can just select directly from the places-tab
can I edit the list manually? until feisty is available
not sure, but go to the drive with nautilus, and then add a bookmark. That place should then be added to that list I think.
